body.p:
Millerstown
Grayson County
Ky
Mr Jas. R. Page
Dear Sir
I Red a Note from you in regard to Mr Jas. T. Howards Case
not giving the name of the officer who tried the case nor the County in which the offence was Commited.

The officer was Benjamin Wheler Esq Justice of the peace in & for the County of Grayson & state of Ky. The offence was commited in the County of Grayson & Town of Millerstown I intended to have writen a letter for Mr Howard but did not get to see him untill after the petition was gone -- as he Howard cannot write, I do not wish to influence the Hon Governor to do anything but what I know or beleave would be rite, but in this case I do think he would do rite & Justice to remit the fine, for Several reasons one is he ^Howard^ is a Loyl a citizen as their is in Ky whilst all Those engaged on the opposite side are as noted Rebels as their is in Ky -- Howard is a member of a home guard has sholdered his Musket by day & Night to defend the his Neighbours, & this & other similar circumstances was the cause of the difficulty all the circumstances if necessary can be given I shall not attem^p^t it as I have not been requested to do so, I remain Yours

Grayson Co
vs
James T. Howard
Breach Peace
$15 --
Remitted 7th Nov/ 63

Remit all except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Govr
